channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq Move Higher After Fed-Fueled Selloff
item.description: Stocks were clawing back some ground after the Federal Reserve triggered a steep selloff by suggesting interest rates could stay higher next year than...

item.title: Sterling's Fall Against Euro Likely to Prove Brief
item.description: The euro was gaining against sterling after the Bank of England’s 6-3 vote to leave interest rates unchanged. Danske Bank expects this weakening of th...

item.title: Government Contractor KBR, Recently Hit by DOGE Fears, Draws Activist Investor
item.description: Irenic Capital Management has built a stake in KBR and plans to push the company to separate its segment that serves the private sector.

item.title: Some Republicans want a bigger child tax credit. Does it have a chance of becoming reality?
item.description: As Republicans get ready to deliver a tax package next year, some prominent GOP lawmakers have voiced support for an expanded child tax credit.

item.title: Americans are ordering steaks but passing on fine dining, says Olive Garden’s owner
item.description: America’s taste for red meat over fine dining powered a healthy sales gain for LongHorn Steakhouse.

item.title: Gold Extends Losses After U.S. GDP Data
item.description: Gold prices extended losses in evening trade in Europe, after the latest U.S. data showed the economy grew faster in the third quarter than previously...

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Rise Ahead of Storage Data
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures were higher ahead of the EIA’s weekly storage report, with gains supported by a cold shot that’s likely to lift demand into t...

item.title: Why stock-market volatility spike signals Wednesday’s rout could be buying opportunity
item.description: Wednesday’s steep selloff in the stock market triggered a sudden spike in Wall Street’s “fear gauge,” posing a buying opportunity for investors and ma...

item.title: The No. 1 New Year’s resolution isn’t losing weight or exercising — it’s this financial goal, surveys say
item.description: Wealth is topping health among many people’s 2025 goals. Here’s how to stick to your financial resolutions.

item.title: Elon Musk’s government shutdown? Here’s what it means for TSA, IPOs and Social Security.
item.description: As U.S. lawmakers wrangle over spending legislation, here’s how some key government functions would be affected by a shutdown.
